\begin{mdInlineSnippet}[7fdd533e5000d9db42dede0ff6324c70]%mdk
$1/2 + p(n)$\end{mdInlineSnippet}%mdk
%mdk-data-line={112}
\begin{mdInlineSnippet}[92eb5ffee6ae2fec3ad71c777531578f]%mdk
$b$\end{mdInlineSnippet}%mdk
%mdk-data-line={112}
\begin{mdDisplaySnippet}[71fd61ae69fa8808389dd16c945b17e0]%mdk
\[%mdk-data-line={115}
\begin{aligned}
  \Pr[A(1^n) = 1 \| b = 1]\frac{1}{2} + \Pr[A(1^n) = 0 \| b = 0] \frac{1}{2} &\geq (1/2 + p(n))(1/2) + (1/2 + p(n))(1/2) \\
  &= \frac{1}{2} + p(n)
\end{aligned} 
\]%mdk
\end{mdDisplaySnippet}%mdk

$z \in U_n$\end{mdInlineSnippet}%mdk

%mdk-data-line={159}
\begin{mdInlineSnippet}[d684584b682bd9155586461943ac0d4c]%mdk
$1 - negl$\end{mdInlineSnippet}%mdk
%mdk-data-line={159}
\begin{mdInlineSnippet}[7fc56270e7a70fa81a5935b72eacbe29]%mdk
$A$\end{mdInlineSnippet}%mdk
%mdk-data-line={159}
\begin{mdInlineSnippet}[37a12b78a9ca96989ad7ceceacb37ea2]%mdk
$A'$\end{mdInlineSnippet}%mdk
%mdk-data-line={159}
\begin{mdInlineSnippet}[cfcd208495d565ef66e7dff9f98764da]%mdk
$0$\end{mdInlineSnippet}%mdk
%mdk-data-line={161}
\begin{mdDisplaySnippet}[0c8236a9100976a1ac78665a4a726a44]%mdk
\[%mdk-data-line={164}
|\E[A'(f(U_{n + 21}))] - \E[A'(U_n)]| = | 1 - negl | = 1 - negl  

Therefore, 

Note that we have already shown that the family of pseudorandom functions produces values 
which are computationally indistinguishable from the uniform. Therefore, assuming the existence of
$A$ leads to a contradiction because we can use $A$ to construct $A'$. We conclude that such an
adversary $A$ cannot exist.  
\]%mdk
\end{mdDisplaySnippet}%mdk

\[%mdk-data-line={407}
\begin{aligned}
  \{ c' \} &\approx \{ c^* \| E''_{k''}(m_0) \} \\

  &\approx \{ E'_{k'}(m_b) \| E''_{k''}(m_b) \} \\
  &\approx \{ E_k(m_b) \}
\end{aligned}
\]%mdk

\begin{mdInlineSnippet}[43748bd543bce59799ebd3b6e442cbd4]%mdk
$m_b = m_{b'}$\end{mdInlineSnippet}%mdk
%mdk-data-line={569}
\begin{mdDisplaySnippet}[b49cf0e85ea14f695ca950456652fa3d]%mdk
\[%mdk-data-line={573}
\begin{aligned}
m_{b'} &= D'_{c^*}(c^{**})) \\
&= D'_{ E'_{e'}(f(d))}( E'_{e'}(m_b)) \\
&=D'_{ E'_{e'}(d)}( E'_{e'}(m_b)) \\
&=  D'_d( E'_{e'}(m_b)) \\
&= m_b
\end{aligned}
\]%mdk
\end{mdDisplaySnippet}%mdk

%mdk-data-line={660}
\begin{mdInlineSnippet}[6892f7e7c3b8ecc19e4a077e82515567]%mdk
$b \in \zo$\end{mdInlineSnippet}%mdk
%mdk-data-line={660}
\begin{mdDisplaySnippet}[5a04d69196c9bfbc59c913b8f69b3aff]%mdk
\[%mdk-data-line={662}
\begin{aligned}
  D'_k(E'_{h,c_1,\cdots,c_m}(b)) &= D_k(EVAL(f, c_1,\cdots,c_m)) \\
  &= f(h_1,\cdots,h_m) \\
  &= \sum_{i = 1}^m h_ix_i \\
  &= b
\end{aligned} 
\]%mdk
\end{mdDisplaySnippet}%mdk
